content.description: Climb broken rock at the start, then fun climbing in wide cracks and huecoed aretes. Top out to belay.
content.protection: Standard rack. A few #4's couldn't hurt.
content.location: Obvious line between the two gear routes that have anchors at the top. Left of the main arete where the wall faces more southwest (morning shade).

content.description: Start up the slightly chossy blocks until you reach the second bolt and a small stance.  Get ready for the fun! From here climb up an insecure corner stemming or doing what ever you can until you reach the giant hueco pocket. Reach up to some good crimps and move slightly right. From here reach right to an arete. Slap your way up until you reach the oh so distant jug ledge. Bust out onto a dirty pocketed face and up to a good rest ledge.  Take the roof out the wide crack on the left side working back right slightly. From here only one more roof stands between you and glory.
content.location: Currently the left most route on the main face. Look for the shinny bolts next to a wide crack.

content.description: Climb broken rock to a cool series of off-width cracks.
content.protection: Big gear. A few 4's and a 5 or two would be well advised.
content.location: Starts left of the arete where the wall faces more southwest. Chain anchor.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
